code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("tiffanymtang/ggwrappers")

title: What the Package Does (One Line, Title Case)
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(ggwrappers) ## basic example code

what: Add color to axis text labels in ggplot — add_axis_text_colors
title: Add color to axis text labels in ggplot — add_axis_text_colors
text: Helper function add color axis text labels ggplot object.

title: Add color to axis text labels in ggplot — add_axis_text_colors
code: add_axis_text_colors(plot, labels, label_colors = NULL, axis = c("x", "y"))

title: Add color to axis text labels in ggplot — add_axis_text_colors
text: plot ggplot object labels Axis text labels label_colors Data vector use coloring axis text labels axis One "x" "y" indicating axis.

title: Add color to axis text labels in ggplot — add_axis_text_colors
text: ggplot object axis text labels colored.

what: Add color and plot theme — add_theme
title: Add color and plot theme — add_theme
text: Add color plot theme

title: Add color and plot theme — add_theme
code: add_theme(   plot,   aesthetic = c("color", "fill"),   discrete = TRUE,   palette = c("1", "2"),   ... )

title: Add color and plot theme — add_theme
text: plot ggplot object aesthetic One "color" "fill" indicating aesthetic add color discrete Logical indicating whether use discrete continuous color/fill scale palette One 1 2 indicating default color palette use ... Additional arguments pass color/fill scale functions

title: Add color and plot theme — add_theme
text: ggplot object color/plot theme added

what: Get aesthetics layer to add to ggplot. — get_aesthetics
title: Get aesthetics layer to add to ggplot. — get_aesthetics
text: Helper function ignore NULL inputs adding aesthetics ggplot.

title: Get aesthetics layer to add to ggplot. — get_aesthetics
code: get_aesthetics(...)

title: Get aesthetics layer to add to ggplot. — get_aesthetics
text: ... Named arguments name argument formatted {aesthetic_name}_str value name variable data frame use aesthetic. example, specify x-axis variable, use x_str = "variable_name".

title: Get aesthetics layer to add to ggplot. — get_aesthetics
text: ggplot2::aes() object.

what: Converts data vector to color vector — get_custom_color_palette
title: Converts data vector to color vector — get_custom_color_palette
text: Converts data vector color vector

title: Converts data vector to color vector — get_custom_color_palette
code: get_custom_color_palette(color_labels, return_palette = FALSE)

title: Converts data vector to color vector — get_custom_color_palette
text: color_labels Vector labels convert colors. return_palette Logical indicating whether return color palette used convert data colors.

title: Converts data vector to color vector — get_custom_color_palette
text: return_palette = FALSE, returns vector colors. return_palette = TRUE, returns list two: colors Vector colors. palette Color palette used convert data colors.

what: Bar plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_bar
title: Bar plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_bar
text: Convenient wrapper function around ggplot2::geom_bar().

title: Bar plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_bar
code: plot_bar(   data,   x_str,   y_str = NULL,   fill_str = NULL,   fill = "#6FBBE3",   stat = "count",   position = "dodge",   ... )

title: Bar plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_bar
text: data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). x_str Character string. Name variable data plot x-axis. y_str Character string. Name variable data plot y-axis. Used stat = "identity". fill_str Character string. Name variable data use fill aesthetic plot. fill Fill color. used fill_str NULL. stat See ggplot2::geom_bar(). position position adjustment use data layer. can used various ways, including prevent overplotting improving display. position argument accepts following: result calling position function, position_jitter(). method allows passing extra arguments position. string naming position adjustment. give position string, strip function name position_ prefix. example, use position_jitter(), give position "jitter". information ways specify position, see layer position documentation. ... arguments pass ggplot2::geom_bar().

title: Bar plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_bar
text: ggplot bar plot.

title: Bar plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_bar
code: df <- data.frame(x = rep(letters[1:3], 2), y = rep(LETTERS[1:2], 3)) plot_bar(data = df, x_str = "x")  plot_bar(df, x_str = "x", fill_str = "y")

title: Boxplot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_boxplot
text: Convenient wrapper around ggplot2::geom_boxplot().

title: Boxplot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_boxplot
code: plot_boxplot(   data,   x_str = NULL,   y_str = NULL,   fill_str = NULL,   horizontal = FALSE,   ... )

title: Boxplot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_boxplot
text: data Data frame use plot. x_str Character string (optional). Name variable data plot x-axis. discrete (e.g., factor variable). y_str Character string. Name variable data plot y-axis. NULL, plot boxplot using values data frame. fill_str Character string. Name variable data use fill aesthetic plot. horizontal Logical. Whether boxplots horizontal instead vertical. ... arguments pass ggplot2::geom_boxplot().

title: Boxplot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_boxplot
text: ggplot boxplot.

title: Boxplot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_boxplot
code: ## plot boxplot of all data in data frame plot_boxplot(as.data.frame(matrix(rnorm(1000), nrow = 100)))  ## plot boxplot of single column in data frame plot_boxplot(iris, y_str = "Sepal.Width")  plot_boxplot(iris, x_str = "Species", y_str = "Sepal.Width")  iris2 <- data.frame(   iris,   z = as.factor(rep(letters[1:2], length.out = nrow(iris))) ) plot_boxplot(iris2, x_str = "Species", y_str = "Sepal.Width", fill_str = "z")  plot_boxplot(iris2, y_str = "Sepal.Width", fill_str = "z")

what: Kernel density plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_density
title: Kernel density plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_density
text: Convenient wrapper around ggplot2::geom_density().

title: Kernel density plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_density
code: plot_density(   data,   x_str = NULL,   fill_str = NULL,   fill = "#6FBBE3",   alpha = 0.4,   ... )

title: Kernel density plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_density
text: data Data frame use plot. x_str Character string. Name variable data plot x-axis. NULL, plot density using values data frame. fill_str Character string. Name variable data use fill aesthetic plot. fill Fill color. used fill_str NULL. alpha Alpha value transparency. ... arguments pass ggplot2::geom_density().

title: Kernel density plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_density
text: ggplot density.

title: Kernel density plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_density
code: ## plot distribution of all data in data frame plot_density(as.data.frame(rnorm(1000), nrow = 100))  ## plot distribution of a single column in data frame plot_density(iris, x_str = "Sepal.Width")  plot_density(iris, x_str = "Sepal.Width", fill_str = "Species")

title: Plot hierarchical clustering dendrograms — plot_hclust
text: Run hierarchical clustering given data matrix plot resulting dendrogram using pretty theme. Also allows coloring leaf nodes.

title: Plot hierarchical clustering dendrograms — plot_hclust
code: plot_hclust(   data,   leaf_labels = rownames(data),   leaf_colors = NULL,   dist_metric = "euclidean",   dist_matrix = NULL,   linkage = "ward.D",   text_size = 10,   title = NULL )

title: Plot hierarchical clustering dendrograms — plot_hclust
text: data Data matrix data.frame perform hierarchical clustering. leaf_labels (Optional) Text labels leaf nodes (e.g., class/outcome labels). leaf_colors (Optional) Data vector use coloring leaf nodes. dist_metric Distance metric clustering (see stats::dist()). dist_matrix (Optional) Distance matrix clustering. Must provide either dist_metric dist_matrix. linkage Type linkage hierarchical clustering (see stats::hclust()). text_size Numeric; size text leaf node labels. title Character string. Title plot.

title: Plot hierarchical clustering dendrograms — plot_hclust
text: list three: plot ggplot object dendrogram. hclust Output stats::hclust() dend Hierarchical clustering dendrogram data. See output ggdendro::dendro_data().

title: Plot hierarchical clustering dendrograms — plot_hclust
code: out <- plot_hclust(data = iris[, -5], leaf_labels = iris$Species,                   leaf_colors = iris$Species) out$plot

title: (Clustered) Heatmap wrappers for ggplot2. — plot_heatmap
text: plot_heatmap generates nice heatmaps data matrix (frame) ease. plot_hclust_heatmap provides additional functionality beyond plot_heatmap allows clustering rows columns heatmap via hierarchical clustering. plot_cor_heatmap generates nice (clustered) heatmaps feature correlation matrix X. heatmap functions also allow row/column groups plotting display, colored axis text labels, customization color/theme.

title: (Clustered) Heatmap wrappers for ggplot2. — plot_heatmap
code: plot_heatmap(   X,   y_groups = NULL,   x_groups = NULL,   ytext_labels = rownames(X),   xtext_labels = colnames(X),   ytext_num = FALSE,   xtext_num = FALSE,   ytext_colors = NULL,   xtext_colors = NULL,   show_ytext = TRUE,   show_xtext = TRUE,   center = FALSE,   scale = FALSE,   z_range = NULL,   text_size = 0,   y_orient = "identity",   size = 0,   color_by_quantile = FALSE,   n_quantiles = 5,   color_scheme = "viridis",   viridis_option = "C",   ... )  plot_hclust_heatmap(   X,   y_groups = NULL,   x_groups = NULL,   ytext_labels = rownames(X),   xtext_labels = colnames(X),   ytext_num = FALSE,   xtext_num = FALSE,   ytext_colors = NULL,   xtext_colors = NULL,   show_ytext = TRUE,   show_xtext = TRUE,   clust_x = TRUE,   clust_y = TRUE,   clust_x_wi_group = TRUE,   clust_y_wi_group = TRUE,   dist_metric_x = "euclidean",   dist_metric_y = "euclidean",   dist_matrix_x = NULL,   dist_matrix_y = NULL,   linkage_x = "ward.D",   linkage_y = "ward.D",   center = FALSE,   scale = FALSE,   z_range = NULL,   text_size = 0,   size = 0,   color_by_quantile = FALSE,   n_quantiles = 5,   color_scheme = "viridis",   viridis_option = "C",   ... )  plot_cor_heatmap(   X,   cor_type = "pearson",   absolute_value = FALSE,   xytext_labels = colnames(X),   xytext_colors = NULL,   show_ytext = TRUE,   show_xtext = TRUE,   clust = TRUE,   linkage = "ward.D",   z_range = c(-1, 1),   text_size = 0,   color_by_quantile = FALSE,   n_quantiles = 5,   color_scheme = "cor_temperature",   viridis_option = "C",   ... )

title: (Clustered) Heatmap wrappers for ggplot2. — plot_heatmap
text: X Data matrix data frame use heatmap. y_groups Data vector group ids use grouping rows heatmap. x_groups Data vector group ids use grouping columns heatmap. ytext_labels y-axis labels heatmap. xtext_labels x-axis labels heatmap. ytext_num Logical; whether y labels numeric/continuous. xtext_num Logical; whether x labels numeric/continuous. ytext_colors (Optional) Data vector use coloring y-axis text. xtext_colors (Optional) Data vector use coloring x-axis text. show_ytext Logical; whether show y-axis text labels. show_xtext Logical; whether show x-axis text labels. center Logical; whether center columns X. scale Logical; whether scale columns X. z_range Vector length 2 min max fill color range heatmap. Used set bounds fill legend. text_size Numeric; size text heatmap. text_size = 0 (default), text shown. y_orient One "identity" "ordered". "identity", plots heatmap X image. "ordered", plots first row X bottom heatmap last row X top. size Size argument ggplot2::geom_tile() avoid white lines continuous heatmap. color_by_quantile Logical; whether use quantiles construct fill color scale. Default FALSE. n_quantiles Number quantiles color scheme. Used color_by_quantile = TRUE. color_scheme One "viridis", "temperature", "cor_temperature", data vector colors use fill color scale. viridis_option Argument indicating viridis palette name. used color_scheme = "viridis". ... arguments pass ggplot2::theme(). clust_x Logical; whether cluster columns. clust_y Logical; whether cluster rows. clust_x_wi_group Logical; whether cluster within x_groups. clust_y_wi_group Logical; whether cluster within y_groups. dist_metric_x Distance metric clustering columns (see stats::dist()). dist_metric_y Distance metric clustering rows (see stats::dist()). dist_matrix_x Distance matrix clustering columns (optional). Must provide either dist_metric dist_mat clust_x = T. dist_matrix_y Distance matrix clustering rows (optional). Must provide either dist_metric dist_mat clust_y = T. linkage_x Type linkage clustering columns (see stats::hclust()). linkage_y Type linkage clustering rows (see stats::hclust()). cor_type Type correlation. Must one "pearson", "kendall", "spearman" absolute_value Logical indicating whether show absolute value correlation values correlation heatmap. xytext_labels x- y-axis labels correlation heatmap. xytext_colors (Optional) Data vector use coloring x- y-axis text labels correlation heatmap. clust Logical; whether cluster columns rows correlation heatmap linkage Type linkage clustering rows columns correlation heatmap (see stats::hclust()).

title: (Clustered) Heatmap wrappers for ggplot2. — plot_heatmap
text: ggplot object.

title: (Clustered) Heatmap wrappers for ggplot2. — plot_heatmap
code: df <- as.data.frame(matrix(1:100, nrow = 10, byrow = 10)) plot_heatmap(df,  y_orient = "identity")  plot_heatmap(df,  y_orient = "ordered")  plot_hclust_heatmap(df)  plot_cor_heatmap(df)

what: Histogram plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_histogram
title: Histogram plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_histogram
text: Convenient wrapper around ggplot2::geom_histogram().

title: Histogram plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_histogram
code: plot_histogram(   data,   x_str = NULL,   fill_str = NULL,   fill = "#6FBBE3",   bins = 12,   ... )

title: Histogram plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_histogram
text: data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). x_str Character string. Name variable data plot x-axis. NULL, plot density using values data frame. fill_str Character string. Name variable data use fill aesthetic plot. fill Fill color. used fill_str NULL. bins Number bins. Overridden binwidth. Defaults 30. ... arguments pass ggplot2::geom_histogram().

title: Histogram plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_histogram
text: ggplot histogram.

title: Histogram plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_histogram
code: ## plot distribution of all data in data frame plot_histogram(as.data.frame(rnorm(1000), nrow = 100))  ## plot distribution of a single column in data frame plot_histogram(iris, x_str = "Sepal.Width")  plot_histogram(iris, x_str = "Sepal.Width", fill_str = "Species")

title: Plot horizontal dot plot. — plot_horizontal_dotplot

title: Plot horizontal dot plot. — plot_horizontal_dotplot
code: plot_horizontal_dotplot(   data,   x_str,   y_str,   color_str = NULL,   line_size = 1,   line_color = "darkgray",   point_size = 8,   ... )

title: Plot horizontal dot plot. — plot_horizontal_dotplot
text: data Data frame use plot. x_str Character string. Name variable data plot x-axis. y_str Character string. Name variable data plot y-axis. color_str Character string. Name variable data use color aesthetic plot. line_size Size line, representing range values. line_color Color line, representing range values. point_size Size point. ... arguments pass ggplot2::geom_point().

title: Plot horizontal dot plot. — plot_horizontal_dotplot
text: ggplot object

title: Plot horizontal dot plot. — plot_horizontal_dotplot
code: df <- data.frame(ID = rep(paste0("ID", 1:3), 2),                  Group = rep(paste0("Group", LETTERS[1:2]), each = 3),                  Value = c(1, 2, 3, -1, 0, 4)) plot_horizontal_dotplot(df, x_str = "Value", y_str = "ID", color_str = "Group")

Name variable data use color aesthetic plot. linetype_str Character string. Name variable data use linetype aesthetic plot. ... arguments pass ggplot2::geom_line().

title: Line plot wrapper for ggplot2 — plot_line
code: df <- data.frame(time = 1:5, value = 5:9) plot_line(df, x_str = "time", y_str = "value")  df2 <- data.frame(   time = rep(1:5, 2),   value = 1:10,   group = rep(letters[1:2], each = 5) ) plot_line(df2, x_str = "time", y_str = "value", color_str = "group")  plot_line(   df2,   x_str = "time", y_str = "value",   color_str = "group", linetype_str = "group" )

title: Custom ggpair plots — plot_pairs
text: Creates pair plots, extending functionality beyond GGally::ggpairs() ability add two different color schemes (one lower triangular subpanels another upper triangular subpanels).

title: Custom ggpair plots — plot_pairs
code: plot_pairs(   data,   columns,   column_labels = NULL,   color_lower = NULL,   color_upper = NULL,   color_label_lower = "",   color_label_upper = "",   color_scheme_lower = NULL,   color_scheme_upper = NULL,   title = "",   point_size = 0.5,   point_alpha = 0.5,   cor_text_size = 3.5,   subsample = 1,   show_upper = TRUE,   drop = TRUE )

title: Custom ggpair plots — plot_pairs
text: data Data frame use plot. columns Vector column indicies column names plot. column_labels (Optional) Label names displayed strips. color_lower (Optional) Data vector use colors lower ggplot panels. color_upper (Optional) Data vector use colors upper ggplot panels. color_label_lower Character string. Label color legend title (used lower ggplot panels). color_label_upper Character string color_upper legend title (used upper ggplot panels). color_scheme_lower (Optional) Vector colors set manual color scheme corresponding color_lower argument (.e., color scheme lower panels). NULL (default), viridis color scheme used. color_scheme_upper (Optional) Vector colors set manual color scheme corresponding color_upper argument (.e., color scheme upper panels). NULL (default), viridis color scheme used. title Character string. Title plot. point_size Point size ggplot2::geom_point(). point_alpha Alpha value ggplot2::geom_point(). cor_text_size Size correlation text. subsample Proportion rows subsample plot. show_upper Logical. show subplots upper panels? drop Logical. Whether drop factors observations.

title: Custom ggpair plots — plot_pairs
text: GGally::ggpairs object.

title: Custom ggpair plots — plot_pairs
code: plot_pairs(data = iris, columns = 1:ncol(iris), color_lower = iris$Species) #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`. #> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.  plot_pairs(   data = iris, columns = 1:4,   color_lower = iris$Species, color_upper = rnorm(nrow(iris)) )

text: data Data frame use plot. x_str Character string. Name variable data plot x-axis. y_str Character string. Name variable data plot y-axis. color_str Character string.
